tree.name: Alperen Sengun
tree.tradeDescription: Draft night trade: Rockets acquired pick #16 from Thunder for 2 protected 1st round picks
tree.note: Turkish center, skilled passer and scorer, traded up to get him

assetsGivenUp.name: Washington 1st Round Pick (protected)
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Rockets traded Russell Westbrook to Wizards for John Wall and this protected 1st round pick (Dec 2, 2020)
assetsGivenUp.note: Lottery protected 2023 (didn't convey, WAS in lottery), top-12 in 2024 (didn't convey, WAS picked #2), top-10 in 2025 (didn't convey, WAS picked #6), top-8 in 2026 (pending), then becomes two 2nds

assetsGivenUp.name: Russell Westbrook
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Rockets sent Chris Paul, 2024 1st (top-4 protected), 2026 1st (top-4 protected), pick swaps in 2021 (top-4 protected) and 2025 (top-20 protected) to Thunder for Westbrook
assetsGivenUp.note: 2017 MVP, traded from Thunder in blockbuster swap with Chris Paul

assetsGivenUp.name: Chris Paul
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: CP3 opted into final year of contract to facilitate trade; Rockets sent Beverley, Lou Williams, Dekker, Harrell, Liggins, Hilliard, Wiltjer, 2018 1st (top-3 protected), and $661K to Clippers
assetsGivenUp.note: 9x All-Star point guard acquired from Clippers in blockbuster

assetsGivenUp.name: Patrick Beverley
assetsGivenUp.note: Signed from Spartak St. Petersburg (Russia) during 2012-13 season; tenacious defender

assetsGivenUp.name: Lou Williams
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Rockets traded Corey Brewer and 2017 1st round pick to Lakers for Lou Williams
assetsGivenUp.note: Three-time Sixth Man of the Year

assetsGivenUp.name: Corey Brewer
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: 3-team trade with MIN and PHI: Rockets sent Troy Daniels and 2015/2016 protected 2nd round picks to MIN, used Jeremy Lin trade exception
assetsGivenUp.note: Veteran swingman from Timberwolves; also got Alexey Shved from PHI in same deal

assetsGivenUp.name: Troy Daniels
assetsGivenUp.note: Undrafted from VCU in 2013; signed from Rio Grande Valley Vipers (G League affiliate)

assetsGivenUp.name: 2015 SAC 2nd Round Pick (via HOU)
assetsGivenUp.note: Originally SAC's pick, acquired by HOU in Jason Terry trade; sent to MIN who traded to CLE; became #36 overall

assetsGivenUp.name: 2016 HOU 2nd Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Sent to MIN in Brewer trade; MIN traded to PHX, then to BOS; became #35 overall, drafted by BOS and traded to MEM

assetsGivenUp.name: 2017 HOU 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Became #28 overall; LAL traded down to #30 (Josh Hart) and sent #28 to Utah who drafted Bradley

assetsGivenUp.name: Sam Dekker
assetsGivenUp.note: 2015 #18 overall pick from Wisconsin

assetsGivenUp.name: Montrezl Harrell
assetsGivenUp.note: 2015 #32 overall pick from Louisville; became 2020 Sixth Man of the Year with LAC

assetsGivenUp.name: 2018 HOU 1st Round Pick (top-3 protected)
assetsGivenUp.note: Conveyed as #30 overall; LAC traded to ATL who drafted Spellman

assetsGivenUp.name: DeAndre Liggins, Darrun Hilliard, Kyle Wiltjer, $661K cash
assetsGivenUp.note: Minor assets included to match salaries

assetsGivenUp.name: 2024 HOU 1st Round Pick (top-4 protected)
assetsGivenUp.note: Conveyed as #12 overall; OKC drafted Serbian guard Nikola Topic

assetsGivenUp.name: 2026 HOU 1st Round Pick (top-4 protected)
assetsGivenUp.note: Still owed to OKC (top-4 protected); OKC traded it onward in Jared McCain deal. If top 4, becomes two 2nds.

assetsGivenUp.name: 2021 Pick Swap Right (top-4 protected)
assetsGivenUp.note: OKC did not exercise the swap in 2021

assetsGivenUp.name: 2025 Pick Swap Right (top-20 protected)
assetsGivenUp.note: OKC could swap if HOU pick was outside top 20; HOU was #2 seed so pick was late

assetsGivenUp.name: Detroit 1st Round Pick (protected)
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Pick acquired from Pistons via Christian Wood trade (Nov 24, 2020)
assetsGivenUp.note: Originally 2022 conditional 1st from DET; didn't convey in 2022-2024, conveyed in 2025 as #17 overall. OKC traded to NYK, then to MIN who selected Beringer.

assetsGivenUp.name: Christian Wood
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Rockets sent Trevor Ariza, Isaiah Stewart, cash and a 2027 2nd round pick to Pistons for Wood, a 2021 2nd (Luka Garza) and this 2025 1st round pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Power forward from UNLV; averaged 21 pts/9.6 reb in 2020-21 with HOU

assetsGivenUp.name: Trevor Ariza
assetsGivenUp.note: Acquired from Portland in Robert Covington trade just 2 days earlier; immediately flipped to DET

assetsGivenUp.name: Isaiah Stewart
assetsGivenUp.note: Acquired from Portland in Robert Covington trade; immediately flipped to DET where he became a starter

assetsGivenUp.name: 2027 HOU 2nd Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Sent to Detroit in Christian Wood trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Cash Considerations
assetsGivenUp.note: Cash sent to Detroit
